wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup: 2/20/2015
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top articles from around the industry so that you can stay up-to-date on the state of employee engagement in CSR and sustainability on the go.

Employee Engagement: Unleash Your Influencers

In today’s connected world, how can big businesses identify their internal influencers to drive change and inspire their people? Information-sharing from traditional forms of top-down communication no longer works. Organizations need to identify their top influencers’the go-to people’ for employees to get honest answers and information from. These people could be the most vocal employees’either an asset or liability to the organization’therefore why not tap into them to get them to help you achieve something positive? Identify influencers by snowball sampling survey techniques. Ask employees, Who do you trust? Then use those people mentioned most often to help you co-create and promote strategy.

The 3 Biggest Takeaways from GreenBiz Forum 15

We were proud to have our CEO & Founder, Susan Hunt Stevens, speak twice during the GreenBiz Forum this week. The event proved to be packed with valuable conversations about how to move the field of sustainable business forward. The 3 themes from the event included: 1) Incrementalism doesn’t match mounting risk, 2) Collaborate’even with competitors, and 3) Think bigger and broader. Stay tuned for recorded sessions from the entire event, including Susan’s presentation!

Employee Engagement Awards and Conference 2015 to launch in North America

In case you haven’t heard, WeSpire is co-sponsoring the launch of the Employee Engagement Awards in North America on June 17th. The one-day event will feature a conference and awards gala to honor the best employee engagement initiatives in North America. The awards celebrate the best small and big businesses’the game-changing, forward-thinking companies that are doing things differently to create an engaging and rewarding work environment. Call for entries are open now through March 24th and finalists will be announced April 14th.

The Untapped Power of Employee Engagement

The recent publication of the 2015 State of Green Business report has confirmed that current sustainability efforts aren’t reducing business environmental impact enough. The only way to increase the rate and effectiveness of efforts is through employee engagement. With the 50 largest companies in the US boasting over 11 million employees collectively, the possibility for impact is incredibly exciting. However, companies rarely report participation performance metrics. How do we increase transparency and reporting?

5 Certain Ways to Engage Employees During Uncertain Times

As companies experience times of tremendous change as markets rapidly evolve and global influence becomes more prominent, leaders are looking to strengthen corporate culture and engage employees more authentically in matters relevant to the brand and organizational goals. The author offers 5 things you should consider in order to keep your employees engaged and maintain their loyalty including being honest and consistent, meeting often and evaluating mindsets, and listening and paying close attention to your department and others in your company.
